titleStmt.title: The French charity written in French by an English gentleman, upon occasion of Prince Harcourt's coming into England ; and translated into English by F.S.J.E.
titleStmt.author: English gentleman.

titleStmt.title: The French charity written in French by an English gentleman, upon occasion of Prince Harcourt's coming into England ; and translated into English by F.S.J.E.
titleStmt.author: English gentleman.
F. S. J. E.
Cotton, Robert, Sir, 1571-1631. Warrs with forregin [sic] princes dangerous to our common-wealth.
Harcourt, Henri de Lorraine, comte de, 1601-1666.
Cotton, Robert, Sir, 1571-1631. An answer made by Sr. Robert Cotton, at the command of Prince Henry, to certain propositions of warre and peace.

notesStmt.note: Appears also in : Warrs with forregin [sic] princes dangerous to our common-wealth / [Sir Robert Bruce Cotton]. London : Printed for William Shears, 1657 (Wing C6505).

Formerly identified as Wing H693 (number cancelled); Wing (2nd ed.) identifies this item as part of "An answer made by Sr. Robert Cotton, at the command of Prince Henry, to certain propositions of warre and peace" (Wing C6478).
Reproduction of original in Bodleian Library.
